001/*

006
007package renderer.models_T;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import renderer.scene.util.MeshMaker;
012
013/**
014   Create a solid model of a barycentricly subdivided
015   equilateral triangle.
016
017   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barycentric_subdivision" target="_top">
018                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barycentric_subdivision</a>
019*/
020public class BarycentricTriangle extends Model implements MeshMaker
021{
022   public final double theta;
023   public final int n;
024
025   /**
026      Create a barycentricly subdivided equilateral triangle
027      in the xy-plane with corners on the unit circle.
028      <p>
029      The value of {@code n} should be less than 8.
030
031      @param n  number of barycentric subdivisions of the triangle
032   */
033   public BarycentricTriangle(final int n)
034   {
035      this(0, n);
036   }
037
038
039   /**
040      Create a barycentricly subdivided equilateral triangle
041      in the xy-plane with corners on the unit circle and
042      rotated by angle {@code theta} degrees.
043      <p>
044      The value of {@code n} should be less than 8.
045
046      @param theta  rotation (in degrees) of the equilateral triangle
047      @param n      number of barycentric subdivisions of this triangle
048      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 0
049   */
050   public BarycentricTriangle(final double theta, final int n)
051   {
052      super(String.format("Barycentric Triangle(%.2f,%d)", theta, n));
053
054      if (n < 0)
055         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n must be greater than or equal to 0");
056
057      this.theta = theta;
058      this.n = n;
059
060      final double theta1 = theta * Math.PI/180.0,
061                   theta2 = 2.0 * Math.PI / 3.0;
062      addVertex(new Vertex(Math.cos(theta1),
063                           Math.sin(theta1),
064                           0.0),
065                new Vertex(Math.cos(theta1 + theta2),
066                           Math.sin(theta1 + theta2),
067                           0.0),
068                new Vertex(Math.cos(theta1 + 2*theta2),
069                           Math.sin(theta1 + 2*theta2),
070                           0.0));
071      if (n > 0)
072      {
073         barycentric(0, 1, 2, n);
074      }
075      else
076      {
077         addPrimitive(new Triangle(0, 1, 2));
078      }
079   }
080
081
082   /**
083      Recursively use barycentric subdivision to put into this
084      {@link Model} vertices and line segments that subdivide
085      the triangle whose vertices are indexed by {@code vIndex0},
086      {@code vIndex1} and {@code vIndex2}.
087      <p>
088      The value of {@code n} should be less than 8.
089
090      @param vIndex0  index of a {link Vertex} of a triangle
091      @param vIndex1  index of a {link Vertex} of a triangle
092      @param vIndex2  index of a {link Vertex} of a triangle
093      @param n        number of barycentric subdivisions of this triangle
094   */
095   public void barycentric(final int vIndex0,
096                           final int vIndex1,
097                           final int vIndex2,
098                           final int n)
099   {
100      final Vertex v0 = vertexList.get(vIndex0),
101                   v1 = vertexList.get(vIndex1),
102                   v2 = vertexList.get(vIndex2);
103      final int index = vertexList.size();
104
105      if (n > 0)
106      {
107         // Barycentric subdivision.
108         // https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barycentric_subdivision
109
110         // Add four vertices to the model.
111         addVertex(new Vertex(
112         //         (1/3)*v0 + (1/3)*v1 + (1/3)*v2
113                    (v0.x + v1.x + v2.x)/3.0,
114                    (v0.y + v1.y + v2.y)/3.0,
115                    (v0.z + v1.z + v2.z)/3.0));
116         addVertex(new Vertex(
117         //         (1/2)*v0 + (1/2)*v1
118                    (v0.x + v1.x)/2.0,
119                    (v0.y + v1.y)/2.0,
120                    (v0.z + v1.z)/2.0));
121         addVertex(new Vertex(
122         //         (1/2)*v1 + (1/2)*v2
123                    (v1.x + v2.x)/2.0,
124                    (v1.y + v2.y)/2.0,
125                    (v1.z + v2.z)/2.0));
126         addVertex(new Vertex(
127         //         (1/2)*v2 + (1/2)*v0
128                    (v2.x + v0.x)/2.0,
129                    (v2.y + v0.y)/2.0,
130                    (v2.z + v0.z)/2.0));
131         // Give a name to the index of each of the four new vertices.
132         final int vIndexCenter = index,
133                   vIndex01     = index + 1,
134                   vIndex12     = index + 2,
135                   vIndex20     = index + 3;
136
137         barycentric(vIndex0, vIndex01, vIndexCenter, n-1);
138         barycentric(vIndex20, vIndex0, vIndexCenter, n-1);
139         barycentric(vIndex01, vIndex1, vIndexCenter, n-1);
140         barycentric(vIndex1, vIndex12, vIndexCenter, n-1);
141         barycentric(vIndex12, vIndex2, vIndexCenter, n-1);
142         barycentric(vIndex2, vIndex20, vIndexCenter, n-1);
143      }
144      else // n == 0
145      {
146         addPrimitive(new Triangle(vIndex0, vIndex1, vIndex2));
147      }
148   }
149
150
151
152   // Implement the MeshMaker interface (three methods).
153   @Override public int getHorzCount() {return this.n;}
154
155   @Override public int getVertCount() {return (int)Math.round(theta);}
156
157   @Override
158   public BarycentricTriangle remake(final int n, final int k)
159   {
160      return new BarycentricTriangle(k, n);
161   }
162}//BarycentricTriangle
